712722f-a.text:
41st Street, 3rd Avenue to 2nd Avenue.
(Before Reconstruction).
President Borough of Manhattan.
December 7, 1919.

712723f-a.text:
41st St. & 3rd Ave. to 2nd Ave (Before reconstruction).
Dec. 7, 1919

712707f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, east from Second Avenue, just before work
began on the Tudor City development.
May 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

712713f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, east from clearing at No. 229, between
Second and Third Avenues.
March 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

712710f-a.text:
E. 41st St. east of, adjoining, and at the NE corner of 2nd. Ave. Essex House at the right, is no. 313-327; and the Hotel Tudor, shown nearing completion, is no. 305-309 E. 41st St. This is the 12th unit of the Tudor City development. The Daily News Bldg (1929) occupies the entire west side of 2nd Ave. from 41st to 42nd Sts.In the background may be seen the Chanin Bldg (1928) in the same position on Lexington Ave.
July 17, 1930

707865f-a.text:
Second Ave., west side, north from but not including East 41st Street.  On the right appears the 42nd Street entrance of the Second Ave. Elevated.
July 24, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

707866f-a.text:
767 Second Avenue, N.W. corner of 4lst Street.
February 6, 1928.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

712708f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, west from, but not including, Second
Avenue.
February 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712709f-a.text:
41st Street, west from and including Second Avenue.
October 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712711f-a.text:
327-307 East 41st Street, north side, east of Second Avenue.
January 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712712f-a.text:
245-229 East 4lst Street, north side, west of Second Avenue, showing buildings to be demolished for the site of the Daily News Building.
February 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712714f-a.text:
216-224o East 4lst Street, south side, west of and towards Second Avenue, seen across the clearing on the north side. No 216, at the right, is a frame house, as is the one-story structure adjoining the corner of Second Avenue.
March 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
